medical_history.chief_complaint: Progressive skin changes associated with secondary hypertrophic osteoarthropathy and symptomatic hypoglycemia due to a solitary fibrous tumor of the lung.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced progressive skin changes over the 6 months prior to treatment, along with symptomatic hypoglycemia. He also reported coarse hair growth and rapid growth of nevi, seborrheic keratoses, and acrochordons. The hypoglycemia and skin changes worsened despite treatment with exogenous growth hormone and prednisone.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Previously diagnosed with growth hormone deficiency and treated with exogenous growth hormone and prednisone for 2 months.
